Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:


  • Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
  • Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
  • Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
  • Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
  • Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
  • Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
  • Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.


Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.


  • Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
  • 5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
  • Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
  • Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
  • Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
  • Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
  • Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
  • Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
  • Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.


What can make you stand out:


  • Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
  • Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
  • Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
  • Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


  • Hybrid Work Model
  • Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
  • Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
  • Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
  • Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
  • Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance with AXA.
  • Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst - Visualización & Negocio (Barcelona)
Description:
Únete a nosotros y forma parte del futuro de BCNC Group🚀




Somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, Reino Unido, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos. #WeHaveOurOwnCode




🔍Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en visualización de datos con enfoque en la generación de valor a negocio a través del análisis de datos trabajando codo a codo con las áreas estratégicas en una empresa referente del sector servicios con gran volumen de usuarios.




✨Qué harás en tu día a día:

Diseñar y construir dashboards claros, visuales y útiles que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Generar storytelling con datos, facilitando la interpretación de la información para las áreas de negocio.
Colaborar de forma estrecha con el Product Owner y con los equipos comerciales y de operaciones, entendiendo sus procesos y retos.
Proponer mejoras y accionables a partir de los datos disponibles.
Promover buenas prácticas en el uso y consumo de la información, con mirada crítica y enfoque en la mejora continua.




✨Qué aspectos claves esperamos de ti:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como analista de datos en proyectos recientes.
Dominio de herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Colaboración estrecha con equipos de negocio para comprender necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones visuales. Se valora capacidad analítica, sentido visual y orientación a la claridad en los datos.
Proactividad y orientación al impacto: no buscamos solo alguien que entregue dashboards, sino que aporte valor desde el análisis.
Trabajo en entornos ágiles (Scrum) y equipos multidisciplinares.




✨Que tenemos para ti:

🤝Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

👩‍💻Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

⌚Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

✨Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

📖Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

🤩Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

🌴Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

🙌🏻Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




Y sobre todo… un buen entorno laboral: nuestros colaboradores puntúan un 4.7 sobre 5 su experiencia en BCNC Group!




Te queremos conocer...

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: BI-Analyst*in
Description:
About

Willst Du gemeinsam mit uns das 36.000 Kilometer lange Berliner Stromnetz fit halten, ausbauen und modernisieren? Willst Du Dich mit voller Kraft für unsere 3,7 Millionen Kundinnen und für eine nachhaltige Stadtgesellschaft engagieren?

Dann unterstütze uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als

BI-Analystin

im Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering in Berlin-Marienfelde.

Wir sind Stromnetz Berlin. Als Mitgestalter der Energiewende halten wir die Stadt am Laufen, geben ihr Energie und bringen sie zum Leuchten.

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Der Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering ist ein Stabstellenbereich der Abteilung Metering. Wir identifizieren aus dem Rechtsrahmen (u.a. MsbG) relevante Änderungsbedarfe und setzen diese um. Zusätzlich koordinieren wir als zentrales Team alle laufenden Projekte, das zentrale Prozessmanagement sowie den Betrieb von IT-Applikationen für die Abteilung. Darüber hinaus betreuen wir die Steuerung von IT-Dienstleistern des Bereiches Metering und sind für die dezentrale Koordination rund um das Thema ISMS verantwortlich. TITL1_DE

Nice-to-have skills


Power BI
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


German

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with a focus on payments and success rate analytics. In this role, you'll use your expertise in Excel and data analytics to analyze payment data, monitor success rates, and provide insights that drive business performance and efficiency.

Responsibilities


Analyze payment data to identify trends and areas for improvement in success rates, transaction volumes, and customer behavior
Utilize Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, Power Query) to clean and analyze large datasets
Provide ad-hoc data analysis to support decision-making across teams
Investigate payment data discrepancies and recommend improvements
Monitor payment system performance and report on success rates
Suggest improvements to enhance payment processes and user experience
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in payment analytics



Requirements


Advanced proficiency in Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, etc.)
Experience in data analysis, particularly with payments or financial data
Ability to analyze large datasets and provide actionable insights
Knowledge of payment systems and transaction processing
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with analytics tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau) is a plus
Strong communication skills for presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders.



Preferred


Familiarity with payment gateways or fraud detection systems
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics



Benefits


Spacious and modern office
Free parking space
Flexible working hours
Free lunch in the office
Social guarantees and health insurance
Company sponsored professional training, certifications ,and conferences
Social events - team building, corporate events
Friendly and experienced team members who will support your professional growth
Hybrid work
Show more

  • Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics


Benefits

  • Spacious and modern office
  • Free parking space
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free lunch in the office
  • Social guarantees and health insurance
  • Company sponsored professional training, certifications ,and conferences
  • Social events - team building, corporate events
  • Friendly and experienced team members who will support your professional growth
  • Hybrid work

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡Únete al equipo de SII Group Spain y ayúdanos a impulsar la transformación digital e innovación!




Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo varios Analista de Datos para uno de nuestros clientes de referencia dentro del sector.




Si estás buscando nuevas oportunidades donde crecer profesionalmente, no dudes en aplicar a a esta oferta 🚀




Conocimientos, habilidades y experiencia requeridas:




Ingeniero o ingeniero técnico o ingeniero de energía, grado en Informática o equivalente o grado en campos científico/técnicos.
Desarrollo y Explotación de Bases de datos SQL SERVER.
Desarrollo y Explotación de Bases de datos MySQL.
Utilización de lenguaje Python.
Diseño y desarrollo de procesos ETL mediante PENTAHO.
Análisis de datos energéticos y/o económicos. Diseño y automatización para el análisis
de datos.
Diseño de informes (POWER BI). Parametrización. Diseño de modelos de datos







¿Quiénes somos?




En SII Group Spain damos respuesta a distintos sectores a través de Servicios y Soluciones Digitales y de IT, Ingeniería, y Consultoría de Negocio, ofreciendo una propuesta de valor integral para afrontar desafíos de transformación digital e innovación. El mundo digital ya no es una promesa para el futuro, sino una vibrante realidad que nos desafía y cautiva a cada paso

Nuestro ADN se basa en el motto “we do what we say” como identificador propio de marca: compromiso, transparencia, calidad y profesionalidad son los valores de nuestra empresa. Trabajamos día a día para atraer y fidelizar al mejor talento. Todo ello es lo que nos ha convertido en Great Place To Work.

Además, conscientes del papel que jugamos como empresa global de servicios tecnológicos, actuamos siempre en favor del desarrollo de tecnologías respetuosas con el entorno. Estamos inmersos en políticas ESG y queremos contribuir positivamente a la sociedad gracias al desarrollo profesional y personal de nuestros ingenieros.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




24 días de vacaciones para que desconectes: 🏖️

Disfruta de un merecido descanso con 24 días hábiles de vacaciones, para que disfrutes de tiempo de calidad!




Contrato indefinido: 📄

Contrato indefinido, brindándote seguridad y confianza en tu futuro profesional.




Jornada intensiva todos los viernes y el mes de agosto: 🗓️

¡Dale la bienvenida al fin de semana antes! Disfruta de jornadas intensivas los viernes y durante todo el mes de agosto para optimizar tu tiempo libre y equilibrar tu vida laboral."




Retribución flexible: 💼

Te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos tales como seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, plataformas de bienestar (WellHub), etc.




Metodología SmartWorking: 🌐

Nos adaptamos a tu estilo de vida con nuestra metodología SmartWorking, que fomenta la flexibilidad y el teletrabajo, permitiéndote alcanzar un equilibrio entre tu carrera y tus compromisos personales.




Oficinas Wellbeing: 🤸‍♂️☕

En nuestra sede de la Agencia West, contamos con instalaciones de bienestar de las que podrás disfrutar: gimnasio equipado, pista de pádel, rocódromo, clases individuales… Además, disponemos de Coffee Corner con café de especialidad para que puedas relajarte y disfrutar de tu pausa.




IT&Engineering Academy: 🎓

Sigue creciendo con nosotros a través de nuestra IT&Engineering Academy, el campus de formación que SII Group Spain pone a tu disposición para que puedas seguir desarrollando nuevas competencias (Hard y Soft Skills), impulsando tu crecimiento profesional y personal.

Además contamos con licencias de Coursera, formación AdHoc e idiomas. 📚




Oportunidad de aprender de grandes profesionales: 👨‍🏫

Aprovecha la oportunidad de aprender de los mejores. Nuestros programas de coaching y mentoring te brindan la guía y el apoyo necesarios para alcanzar tu máximo potencial.

Tenemos Convenios con distintas Asociaciones y Colegios de Ingenieros, brindándote la posibilidad de acceder a formaciones y normativa específica. 📝




Proyección de futuro y estabilidad: 🚀

Diseña tu propio camino hacia el éxito con nuestro plan de carrera personalizado, que te ofrece proyección de futuro y estabilidad a largo plazo en un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y motivador.




Movilidad geográfica: 🌍

Explora nuevas oportunidades y experiencias internacionales con nuestra opción de movilidad geográfica, permitiéndote expandir tus horizontes tanto profesional como personalmente.




Eventos de empresa y networking: 🤝

Forma parte de una comunidad cercana y vibrante. Desde after-works hasta cenas y eventos exclusivos, te ofrecemos la oportunidad de conectar y disfrutar del mejor ambiente laboral. Únete a nuestras fiestas trimestrales. 🎉




Programa de referenciados: 📣

Deseamos atraer a los profesionales más destacados y, para lograrlo, te incentivamos a que nos refieras a aquellos talentos excepcionales que conozcas




Plan de rebranding: 🔄

Forma parte de nuestros embajadores de marca en redes sociales, contribuyendo a la estrategia de rebranding de la empresa, así como optando a distintos premios.




Great Place to Work: 😊

Únete a un equipo donde se valora tu bienestar y se promueve un ambiente inclusivo y positivo. ¡Somos un Great Place to Work reconocido por nuestro excepcional clima laboral!

¿Cómo será el proceso de selección?

En la primera fase se llevará a cabo una llamada telefónica con el reclutador, en la segunda una entrevista con el responsable de Talent y/o Operaciones, junto a una prueba técnica y, por último, se valorará la prueba conjuntamente con el responsable del departamento en cuestión.

En SII Group Spain, garantizamos igualdad de oportunidades para todos los candidatos, sin importar su raza, género, religión o condición sexual. Valoramos la diversidad y creemos en un entorno laboral inclusivo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad. Trabajamos juntos para construir una organización que respeta y valora las diferencias, asegurando un espacio en el que todos puedan prosperar y contribuir al éxito colectivo.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre nosotros:




En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.




El rol:




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos.

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.




¿Cuál será tu misión?




Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.
Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.
Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.
Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.
Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.
Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.
Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.




Lo que te hará triunfar:




+2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.
Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.
Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.
Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.
Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.




Beneficios:

🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina

Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti!

Title: Data Analyst – Digital Transformation
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst – Digital Transformation

Sector: Technology

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: Negotiable plus bonus, health, and pension




Our Client

Our client is a fast-growing technology company with a strong presence in the digital transformation space. They specialise in providing innovative solutions that enhance automation, data-driven decision-making, and cloud adoption. With a focus on continuous growth and market expansion, they are now looking to hire a Data Analyst to strengthen their analytics capabilities.




Why Should You Apply?

Opportunity to work in a forward-thinking company that values data-driven insights.
Collaborate with a highly skilled team in an agile and innovative environment.
Work on cutting-edge data projects with cloud-based technologies.
Great potential for career progression within a rapidly expanding organisation.




Who Should Apply?

This role is ideal for professionals with a strong analytical background and a passion for data, including:

2+ years of experience in data analysis.
A degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Snowflake, DBT, or Redshift).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.




Role and Reporting Lines

This position reports to the Data Analytics Lead and will involve:

Developing and maintaining key datasets and data models.
Collecting, processing, and analysing large datasets to support business decisions.
Creating dashboards and reports to visualise insights for stakeholders.
Collaborating with engineers and business leaders to define data requirements.
Ensuring data quality, integrity, and governance across platforms.
Implementing best practices in data management and analytics.
Staying up to date with industry trends and emerging data technologies.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below. For further inquiries, please contact Emma directly.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Our Lineup




We are Tipico, the leading sports betting provider in Germany and one of the most exciting tech companies in the industry. We are fueled by our passion for the perfect product, using the newest tech stack to make advances every single day. Our culture is bursting with energy and ambition where we generate intense moments of Spannung, thriving through our values of Trust, Progress, and Passion. We push the limits of what’s possible because we believe that when adrenaline meets progress, awesome things happen.




Job Description




In football, data drives every decision - from player performance to game strategy. In our Customer Operations team, we need a data champion to help us win by turning raw data into actionable insights. Your dashboards, reports, and analyses will be the playbook that helps our team make smarter, faster decisions. You’ll work closely with our CO teams, ensuring they have the right data at the right time to drive continuous improvement. Just like a top coach relies on stats to refine strategy, our success will depend on your ability to spot patterns, uncover insights, and deliver game-changing recommendations. This role isn’t just about crunching numbers - it’s about leading our data game and making sure we play to win.




Are you ready to turn up the power and bring the thrill of Spannung into your working life? Then show us your game face – because we’re looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/x) to join the team!




Your playing field:




Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights—helping the team stay ahead of the competition.
Conduct in-depth data exploration and statistical analysis to ensure every move is backed by solid data.
Build dynamic dashboards and reports using DOMO, Tableau, or other tools to turn complex data into clear, accessible insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports that are accurate, up-to-date, and packed with value—giving our team the intelligence they need to make game-winning decisions.
Work with data engineers and IT teams to ensure data accuracy, flag anomalies, and improve data quality - because precision is everything.
Collaborate with different Customer Operations functions to understand their data needs and provide meaningful, actionable insights that drive performance.
Maintain clear documentation of dashboards, reporting methodologies, and analysis techniques - keeping our data strategies sharp.
Leverage AI and automation to streamline reporting and analysis, keeping our team ahead of the game.




Qualifications




Which skills should you bring to the pitch:




Education. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics or in a similar field.
Technical Background. 5 years experience working in a similar role with 2+ years experience in
Python and SQL. Your go-to tools for extracting and analyzing data.
Visualisations. Experience with dashboarding and visualisation tools like DOMO or Tableau.
Eye For Detail. A keen eye for data accuracy, insights, and process improvements.
iGaming. Experience within the iGaming industry, specifically within Customer Operations would be considered as a plus.
#OneTeam Mentality. At Tipico, we play to win together. We’re looking for a team player who is self-driven, focused, and an excellent communicator—someone who steps up, takes responsibility, and always aims for the best results.




Additional Information




This is how we score with you:




Established International Group. We have a solid foundation on which to grow.
Personal and Professional Growth. We offer you opportunities to develop and grow to unlock your potential.
Relocation Support. To make your move to Malta as smooth as possible.
Competitive Package. We care for our employees, offering a competitive salary, Private health and dental insurance and subsidized parking.
On-site childcare. Worried about where to leave your 3+ year-old kids? We’ve got a game plan.
Gym Allowance. Because we love Sports!
Modern offices. Our very own Tipico tower provides an open-plan space with the latest technology.
Events. Sponsored Charity and Team gatherings, we like to have fun together as one team and reinforce our connections.
Supportive Environment. We believe in collaboration and working together as a team but we also give importance to the uniqueness of each and every one of us.




Think a career at Tipico’s right for you? Apply now and join our winning team!




If you have any questions or comments about this role, our TA team is happy to help you! Feel free to reach out to us on our social media channels.




We look forward to your application!

Show more
HTML:
Our Lineup


We are Tipico, the leading sports betting provider in Germany and one of the most exciting tech companies in the industry. We are fueled by our passion for the perfect product, using the newest tech stack to make advances every single day. Our culture is bursting with energy and ambition where we generate intense moments of Spannung, thriving through our values of Trust, Progress, and Passion. We push the limits of what’s possible because we believe that when adrenaline meets progress, awesome things happen.


Job Description


In football, data drives every decision - from player performance to game strategy. In our Customer Operations team, we need a data champion to help us win by turning raw data into actionable insights. Your dashboards, reports, and analyses will be the playbook that helps our team make smarter, faster decisions. You’ll work closely with our CO teams, ensuring they have the right data at the right time to drive continuous improvement. Just like a top coach relies on stats to refine strategy, our success will depend on your ability to spot patterns, uncover insights, and deliver game-changing recommendations. This role isn’t just about crunching numbers - it’s about leading our data game and making sure we play to win.


Are you ready to turn up the power and bring the thrill of Spannung into your working life? Then show us your game face – because we’re looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/x) to join the team!


Your playing field:


  • Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights—helping the team stay ahead of the competition.
  • Conduct in-depth data exploration and statistical analysis to ensure every move is backed by solid data.
  • Build dynamic dashboards and reports using DOMO, Tableau, or other tools to turn complex data into clear, accessible insights for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports that are accurate, up-to-date, and packed with value—giving our team the intelligence they need to make game-winning decisions.
  • Work with data engineers and IT teams to ensure data accuracy, flag anomalies, and improve data quality - because precision is everything.
  • Collaborate with different Customer Operations functions to understand their data needs and provide meaningful, actionable insights that drive performance.
  • Maintain clear documentation of dashboards, reporting methodologies, and analysis techniques - keeping our data strategies sharp.
  • Leverage AI and automation to streamline reporting and analysis, keeping our team ahead of the game.


Qualifications


Which skills should you bring to the pitch:


  • Education. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics or in a similar field.
  • Technical Background. 5 years experience working in a similar role with 2+ years experience in
  • Python and SQL. Your go-to tools for extracting and analyzing data.
  • Visualisations. Experience with dashboarding and visualisation tools like DOMO or Tableau.
  • Eye For Detail. A keen eye for data accuracy, insights, and process improvements.
  • iGaming. Experience within the iGaming industry, specifically within Customer Operations would be considered as a plus.
  • #OneTeam Mentality. At Tipico, we play to win together. We’re looking for a team player who is self-driven, focused, and an excellent communicator—someone who steps up, takes responsibility, and always aims for the best results.


Additional Information


This is how we score with you:


  • Established International Group. We have a solid foundation on which to grow.
  • Personal and Professional Growth. We offer you opportunities to develop and grow to unlock your potential.
  • Relocation Support. To make your move to Malta as smooth as possible.
  • Competitive Package. We care for our employees, offering a competitive salary, Private health and dental insurance and subsidized parking.
  • On-site childcare. Worried about where to leave your 3+ year-old kids? We’ve got a game plan.
  • Gym Allowance. Because we love Sports!
  • Modern offices. Our very own Tipico tower provides an open-plan space with the latest technology.
  • Events. Sponsored Charity and Team gatherings, we like to have fun together as one team and reinforce our connections.
  • Supportive Environment. We believe in collaboration and working together as a team but we also give importance to the uniqueness of each and every one of us.


Think a career at Tipico’s right for you? Apply now and join our winning team!


If you have any questions or comments about this role, our TA team is happy to help you! Feel free to reach out to us on our social media channels.


We look forward to your application!

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Participa en innovadores proyectos de ingeniería, aportando al equipo tu experiencia en el área de gestión y análisis de datos.




En ALTEN, sabemos que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 4 años de experiencia en Análisis de Datos y estás buscando un nuevo desafío, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




Participación en proyectos relacionados con los sectores Espacio, Defensa y Eficiencia Energética.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos?

Formación Académica: Ingeniería Técnica y/o Superior
Experiencia de al menos 4 años en trabajando en análisis de datos.
Valorable: Tener experiencia en BBDD de SQL y en el lenguaje de programación Python.
Nivel de inglés: Intermedio - Alto




🎯 ¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?

Análisis de datos dentro del entorno energético y económico.
Diseño y automatización para el análisis de datos.
Diseño y Desarrollo de procesos ETL.
Diseño de informes en POWER BI y Diseño de modelos de datos.




🌟 ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




🌍 ¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 3.650 millones de euros, contamos con 52.700 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Title: Reinsurance Data Analyst
Description:
At Abrivia, we are working with a company seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join a dynamic team specialising in data management and analytics within a global reinsurance environment. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on international datasets, support strategic decision-making, and enhance the efficiency of data processes across the business.




Key Responsibilities

Interpret, centralise, and manage incoming data from a global client base.
Prepare internal reports for senior management, committees, and regulatory bodies.
Support data-driven decision-making through insightful analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and streamline processes.
Drive innovation and efficiency in data management practices.
Contribute to continuous improvements in data quality and reporting accuracy.




Skills & Experience Required

Strong numerical and analytical abilities with clear communication skills.
Proven project or task planning capability in a data-focused environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, international setting.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Business Objects.
Advanced Excel skills, including the use of formulas, pivot tables, and data visualisation tools.
A proactive mindset with a focus on innovation and continuous improvement.




Please apply here or email sam.healy@abrivia.ie for more details.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For our client, a major player in the Belgian utilities sector, we are currently looking for a data analyst to reinforce their retail team:




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
Generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
Maintain close relationships with the business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of the business processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
Respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
Drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
Present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.




SKILLS

Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Agile and results-focused work ethic.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
Excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.
MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or equivalent experience.
Expert knowledge of SQL is required.
Expert knowledge of data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R is required
Expert knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik is required







Position in the Organization

Reports to the Data Analysis Manager.
Collaborates closely with team managers in Retail and squad leads.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Planner & Data Analyst Executive
Description:
The Planner & Sales Data Analyst Executive will be responsible for analysing sales data, creating actionable insights, and managing planning processes to support the company’s business objectives. This role involves developing interim planning tools using BI and Excel during the ERP implementation phase and transitioning these processes into the ERP system.




Responsibilities:

Develop sales forecasts and production plans based on historical data and market trends.
Collaborate with internal teams to optimize production, storage, and delivery operations to ensure product freshness and efficiency.
Gather and analyse data from internal and external sources, including merchandisers, category outlets, and national/international statistics.
Identify distribution gaps and channel development opportunities within the product portfolio.
Conduct profitability analysis for key accounts and recommend corrective actions for underperforming clients.
Create and maintain data models, central dashboards, and databases to support decision-making processes.
Perform regular data quality checks to ensure accuracy and integrity across all reports.
Prepare and present data-driven insights through reports, presentations, and visual dashboards.
Provide actionable recommendations to internal stakeholders to drive business improvements.
Analyse competitor pricing strategies and propose pricing alignments for all products.
Continuously evaluate and improve planning tools and processes to align with business needs.
Design, develop, and deliver customized reports to meet the organization’s needs, ensuring accuracy and relevance.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Valid driving license.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably within the FMCG industry.
Hands-on experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and advanced proficiency in Excel.
Experience with ERP systems or involvement in ERP implementation is an advantage.
Fluency in English is essential. Proficiency in Maltese will be considered an asset.
Advanced computer skills, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint, for reporting and presentations.
Strong analytical skills with experience in business analysis, data integrity, and creating dashboards.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively share data findings and insights.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.




Location: Central Malta

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Allianz Services is proud to serve and be part of Allianz Group, one of the world's leading insurers and asset managers. Our global footprint, with more than 7,300 employees located across ten countries and four continents, enables us to unlock value for our partners across the insurance value chain and deliver superior client experience within Allianz Group. At Allianz Services, we have a strong specialization in core insurance operations, shared services, business analytics, engineering, and management consulting. Our people and our trusted relationships with partners are what matter most. These are rooted in our values of compassion, integrity, and expertise and we strive to continuously evolve, improve, and deliver excellence while contributing successfully to the transformation of Allianz. Caring actively for the environment, for people, and for our customers is what makes us a great place to work and together we are shaping a better and more caring tomorrow.

Allianz Services is a company which belongs to the legal entity, Allianz Technology SE.

Job role

The Pricing Data Engineering & Automation team is part of the Global Pricing department at Allianz Commercial and is responsible for driving the development of data solutions within Pricing across Allianz Commercial globally. You will join an international department located across London, Munich, Bucharest, Chicago and New York.

Our global Pricing Data Engineering & Automation team is seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst for a role within the Pricing Function. In this role, you will work closely with the Head of Pricing Data Engineering & Automation and other key stakeholders to interrogate data and implement pipelines across the various Lines of Business and regions in Allianz Commercial to support advanced pricing.

We are looking for someone who is willing to get hands on with the company’s data and to develop innovative and structured solutions to bring it together in a way that maximises its potential. This person will need to collaborate internationally with various stakeholders, both within the Pricing Function and across other Allianz Commercial functions.

What You Will Do


Drive best practices for data quality and root cause analysis across the team, and coach and mentor junior team members
Act as a bridge between data teams and other stakeholders, and advise leadership on data quality risks and critical improvements
Investigate and interpret data flows from pricing tools and booking systems, identifying and explaining issues and behaviors to Data Engineers and project team
Trace data sources, transformations and dependencies to pinpoint errors, inconsistencies and inefficiencies in pricing data assets
Build dashboards, reports and recommend automated checks to track data integrity, flag anomalies, and provide insights on data reliability to key stakeholders
Analyze data and work with team members in Pricing and Underwriting to configure mappings for ambiguous data attributes
Document and present on findings, including the creation of data dictionaries and visualizations for end-users to enable them to use datasets
Support end-users and collaborate with them to improve readiness of base datasets for modelling
Collaborate with Data Engineers, Pricing Actuaries and Predictive Modelers to deliver innovative data solutions for data-driven pricing
Develop knowledge of the company’s IT landscape, data and data systems
Contribute to a culture of results-driven collaboration, support and respect


What You Bring


Minimum 8 years’ experience using SQL for data analysis, with at least 2 years experience in P&C insurance
A degree at BSc or MSc level in a Numerical field, preferably with a strong focus on Computer Science, or qualified by experience
Experience in gathering information from stakeholders to understand business workflows
Experience in analyzing, debugging and solving highly complex problems
Experience in coaching and mentoring team members of varying functions and levels in data quality and root cause analysis techniques
Experience using Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools for data visualization and anomaly detection
Knowledge of P&C insurance, ideally with some experience of working alongside Pricing teams
Experience taking ownership of own learning and development


You have


Experience using PySpark (nice to have)
Some experience using cloud-based platforms for data analysis (e.g. Azure Synapse) (nice to have)
Some understanding of data engineering and machine learning project lifecycles (nice to have)
Independent and self-directed individuals that thrive when faced with challenge
Ability to communicate and work effectively with technical and non-technical team members
Desire and ability to learn the business and become an expert in the industry
Organised, self-motivated, results-oriented, and very resourceful
Relishes problem solving, analysis and getting hands on digging into data issues
Fluent English skills, any other languages advantageous


What We Offer

We support your well-being

We foster an inclusive and healthy workplace with a flexible hybrid working model:


Experience access to counseling services, mental health resources, and well-being sessions designed to keep you feeling your best
Enjoy a monthly budget via the Benefit platform, for personalized benefits packages, including comprehensive medical subscriptions, meal tickets, private pensions plans, life insurance, Allianz Tiriac insurance discounts, and many more .
Prioritize what truly matters with time off for your birthday, extra days off for each year in Allianz (up to 5) , days off for legal holidays that fall on weekends, as well as 24th and 31st of December, plus special allowances to support diverse life events.


We invest in your growth

Benefit from an extensive learning curriculum designed to support your career advancement and meet your professional needs, with access to technical and soft-skills trainings, international certifications ( Agile, Lean Six Sigma, Prince, ITIL, IFOA, ACCA, IACCM and more), learning resources from LinkedIn and Allianz platforms, opportunities to advance your languages skills(German, French, English) and elevate with our leadership Program.

We value you and your work

We acknowledge and recognize your work through performance based-rewards to celebrate your achievements, team and individual recognition programs to celebrate your contributions and internal referral bonuses.

Your personal information, including sensitive data, may be shared with Hiring Managers to assess your suitability as a candidate. Only suitable candidates will be contacted, and all applications are confidential. Allianz Group, a trusted global insurance and asset management company, values employee ambitions and challenges, fostering an empowering environment. We are committed to diversity and inclusion, welcoming applications from all backgrounds, regardless of ethnicity, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, encouraging you to bring your whole self to work.


Show more

  • Document and present on findings, including the creation of data dictionaries and visualizations for end-users to enable them to use datasets
  • Support end-users and collaborate with them to improve readiness of base datasets for modelling
  • Collaborate with Data Engineers, Pricing Actuaries and Predictive Modelers to deliver innovative data solutions for data-driven pricing
  • Develop knowledge of the company’s IT landscape, data and data systems
  • Contribute to a culture of results-driven collaboration, support and respect

What You Bring

  • Minimum 8 years’ experience using SQL for data analysis, with at least 2 years experience in P&C insurance
  • A degree at BSc or MSc level in a Numerical field, preferably with a strong focus on Computer Science, or qualified by experience
  • Experience in gathering information from stakeholders to understand business workflows
  • Experience in analyzing, debugging and solving highly complex problems
  • Experience in coaching and mentoring team members of varying functions and levels in data quality and root cause analysis techniques
  • Experience using Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools for data visualization and anomaly detection
  • Knowledge of P&C insurance, ideally with some experience of working alongside Pricing teams
  • Experience taking ownership of own learning and development

You have

  • Experience using PySpark (nice to have)
  • Some experience using cloud-based platforms for data analysis (e.g. Azure Synapse) (nice to have)
  • Some understanding of data engineering and machine learning project lifecycles (nice to have)
  • Independent and self-directed individuals that thrive when faced with challenge
  • Ability to communicate and work effectively with technical and non-technical team members
  • Desire and ability to learn the business and become an expert in the industry
  • Organised, self-motivated, results-oriented, and very resourceful
  • Relishes problem solving, analysis and getting hands on digging into data issues
  • Fluent English skills, any other languages advantageous

What We Offer

 We support your well-being

We foster an inclusive and healthy workplace with a flexible hybrid working model:

  • Experience access to counseling services, mental health resources, and well-being sessions designed to keep you feeling your best
  • Enjoy a monthly budget via the Benefit platform, for personalized benefits packages, including comprehensive medical subscriptions, meal tickets, private pensions plans, life insurance, Allianz Tiriac insurance discounts, and many more .
  • Prioritize what truly matters with time off for your birthday, extra days off for each year in Allianz (up to 5) , days off for legal holidays that fall on weekends, as well as 24th and 31st of December, plus special allowances to support diverse life events.

We invest in your growth

Benefit from an extensive learning curriculum designed to support your career advancement and meet your professional needs, with access to technical and soft-skills trainings, international certifications ( Agile, Lean Six Sigma, Prince, ITIL, IFOA, ACCA, IACCM and more), learning resources from LinkedIn and Allianz platforms, opportunities to advance your languages skills(German, French, English) and elevate with our leadership Program.

We value you and your work

We acknowledge and recognize your work through performance based-rewards to celebrate your achievements, team and individual recognition programs to celebrate your contributions and internal referral bonuses.

Your personal information, including sensitive data, may be shared with Hiring Managers to assess your suitability as a candidate. Only suitable candidates will be contacted, and all applications are confidential. Allianz Group, a trusted global insurance and asset management company, values employee ambitions and challenges, fostering an empowering environment. We are committed to diversity and inclusion, welcoming applications from all backgrounds, regardless of ethnicity, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, encouraging you to bring your whole self to work.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🔍 Empower Data, Drive Insight, and Elevate Decision-Making – Right from Madrid! 🇪🇸




Are you someone who gets excited about turning raw data into real impact? 📊 At FERO, we're on the lookout for a Junior Data Analyst who's eager to dig deep into data, support internal reporting, investigate issues, and bring clarity to complex questions across teams—from ops and product to sales and customer success. You’ll be a key player in driving data excellence, supporting strategic decisions, and helping us grow smarter, faster. 🚀




Who We Are

We're FERO, a high-growth startup reinventing the checkout and payment experience 💳 to help our customers increase conversions and revenue. Backed by top-tier VCs, we’re building our future from the heart of Madrid, combining cutting-edge tech 🖥️ with a collaborative, data-driven culture.




We offer:




💰 Competitive pay

🩻 Half sponsored Private Health Insurance

✨ The chance to make a real difference in an environment that values curiosity, creativity, and impact




What You'll Do




🔎 Investigate and Analyse: Support incident investigations and root-cause analyses with data insights and exploratory analysis.

🤝 Enable Sales & Success Teams: Help prepare data-driven materials and insights for customer proof-of-concepts and strategic conversations.

🧹 Push Data Quality: Help monitor data pipelines, identify inconsistencies, and contribute to cleaner, more reliable datasets.

📊 Internal Reporting & Dashboards: Help design and maintain reports that provide clear visibility into key business metrics.

🔗 Work Cross-Functionally: Collaborate with engineering, product, and business stakeholders to answer critical questions and support decision-making.

📚 Build Data Culture: Help foster data literacy and support the adoption of better data practices throughout the company.




What We Offer




🧠 Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge solutions in a greenfield setting.

🌱 Growth Opportunities: Join us early and grow with us professionally and personally.

🤗 Collaborative Culture: Be part of a friendly, creative, and supportive team.

🏠 Flexible Work: Hybrid model - 3 days in office, 2 days WFH.

💼 Competitive Compensation: Great pay, employee equity, and private health insurance partially sponsored by FERO.

Who You Are

🧐 Analytically Curious: You love exploring messy datasets, spotting patterns, and figuring out what the data really says.

🐍 Python Fluent: Comfortable using Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) for data cleaning, analysis, and basic visualisations.

🗣️ Clear Communicator: Able to present findings in a structured, simple, and actionable way - both in writing and in conversation.

🔍 Detail-Oriented: You have an eye for accuracy and consistency when working with data.

🤝 Collaborative & Proactive: You enjoy working in a team and aren’t afraid to ask questions or speak up with ideas.

🚀 Eager to Grow: You’re hungry to learn and ready to grow in both technical and business dimensions.

✅ Eligible to Work in Spain




Ready to Join Us?

Excited to make a difference? 💥 Send us your English CV and let's get started on this amazing journey together! 🎉

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europe’s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. You’ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Advanced Analytics
Description:
Job Description

Role Description

As a Senior Data Analyst specializing in Advanced Analytics, you will lead complex analytics projects, mentor team members, and enhance our data landscape with advanced analytical techniques. You will leverage your expertise in data analytics, machine learning, and statistical modeling to provide actionable insights and drive data-driven decision-making. Your role will involve collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs, interpret predictive models, and implementing innovative solutions to solve complex business problems. Additionally, you will stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics to continuously improve our data processes and systems.

Responsibilities


Lead complex analytics projects to provide actionable insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Contribute to developing predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes
Analyze the output of machine learning algorithms to automate decision-making processes and improve business operations.
Conduct advanced statistical analysis to understand data distributions, relationships, and trends.
Design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses and assess the business impact of changes in strategy or new features
Create and maintain data models to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders, using data-driven insights to influence decision-making.
Mentor junior data analysts and provide guidance on advanced analytical techniques and best practices.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics to continuously improve data processes and systems.



Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
High proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and advanced analytical techniques.
Experience with data mining and data wrangling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Advanced presentation skills, with the ability to engage and persuade senior stakeholders with data-driven insights.
Experience with designing and conducting experiments to test hypotheses and assess the impact of changes.
Proven ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members.
Continuous learning mindset and ability to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics.



Additional Information

This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Helping ideas grow




En FI Group ayudamos a pequeñas y grandes empresas a desarrollar sus ideas innovadoras a través de la obtención de incentivos fiscales, ayudas o subvenciones, a nivel nacional e internacional.

Apostamos por la I+D+i como base para la creación de compañías más competitivas que aporten soluciones para cambiar el presente y mejorar el futuro de nuestra sociedad.




¿Por qué trabajar con nosotros?




Nuestro mayor valor son las personas que conforman FI Group. Simpatía, cercanía, profesionalidad y agilidad son las señas de identidad de nuestro equipo humano. El esfuerzo, el entusiasmo, la pasión y la capacidad de innovar que nos caracterizan, nos llevan a emprender proyectos motivadores que convierten nuestro día a día en un reto.




Buscamos un Analista de Datos que ayude a organizar, estructurar y analizar datos provenientes de empresas externas, optimizando el proceso de integración y cruce de información. La persona seleccionada trabajará con grandes volúmenes de datos, principalmente en Excel, utilizando Power Pivot para modelado y análisis.

Responsabilidades




Recibir, organizar y procesar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes (principalmente en Excel)
Implementar modelos de datos en Power Pivot, creando relaciones eficientes entre tablas.
Optimizar la estructura de los datos para facilitar su análisis y reducir el tiempo de procesamiento manual.
Automatizar tareas repetitivas mediante macros (VBA), Power Query o Power Automate.
Identificar errores y oportunidades de mejora en la gestión de datos.
Brindar soporte a los equipos operativos en el uso de las herramientas de análisis.
Generar reportes y dashboards en Excel o Power Bi según necesidades del negocio.







¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




Experiencia comprobada en análisis y tratamientos de datos.
Dominio avanzado de Excel (Power Pivot, Power Query, tablas dinámicas, funciones avanzadas)
Experiencia en modelado de datos y estructura de la información.
Conocimiento en VBA (macros) para automatización de procesos.
Habilidad para manejar grandes volúmenes de datos y optimizar tiempos de análisis.
Capacidad para documentar procesos y crear plantillas reutilizables.
Deseable: Conocimientos en Power BI, SQL o herramientas de BI.
Perfil analítico, metódico y orientado a la eficiencia operativa.







¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Queremos que estés a gusto y ser más que un trabajo para ti. Para hacerlo posible tenemos un pack de beneficios sociales adaptados a tus necesidades:

· Muy buen ambiente de trabajo rodeado de personal joven que te ayudará a crecer profesionalmente.

· Incorporación a empresa líder en su sector en constante crecimiento.

· Tendrás jornada flexible cada día, además los viernes y en verano harás jornada intensiva.

· Teletrabajo.

· Gimnasio en la oficina, además de fruta, snacks y Ticket Restaurant para que lo uses cuando quieras.

· Queremos que crezcas con nosotros y para hacértelo fácil tenemos un plan de carrera y formación diseñado para que puedas dar lo mejor de ti.

· Garantizamos total confidencialidad en todos los procesos

· Ya sabes que para nosotros el buen ambiente es muy importante, así que podrás disfrutar con tus compañeros de diferentes actividades (Solidarias, deportivas, etc)




¡Te esperamos con los brazos abiertos! ¿Te apuntas?




F. Iniciativas España I+D+i, S.L. le informa que sus datos han sido incorporados a un fichero automatizado con la finalidad de avanzar en los procesos de selección. Los datos recogidos son almacenados bajo la confidencialidad y las medidas de seguridad legalmente establecidas. Igualmente deseamos informarle que podrá ejercer sus derechos a través del siguiente correo electrónico: rgpd@fi-group.com

Para conocer nuestra política de privacidad en mayor detalle pinche https://es.fi-group.com/politica-de-privacidad/
