Title: Analista de datos-Power BI
Description:
¡Diseña el futuro de la tecnología con nosotros! 🌟




En Wordlgrid, buscamos un/a analista de datos con experiencia contrastada en Power BI con pasión por crear soluciones innovadoras y escalables en entornos de vanguardia. 🚀.




📍 Ubicación: Madrid, Sevilla, Barcelona, Santander




¿Qué buscamos?




Responsabilidades:




Soporte a usuarios:

Atención al buzón de soporte y atención a usuarios para la herramienta de gestión de activos en servicio SAGA
Catalogación de la información recibida en el buzón
Primera capa de soporte a usuarios ante dudas de proceso, parametrización de datos y soporte general a usuarios.
Modificación/corrección de datos para resolución de dudas/incidencias de usuarios.
Reportes periódicos (semanales) de los indicadores anteriores, identificando temática, emisor, encargado de gestión de la incidencia/petición, grado de avance y adherencia al estándar de atención objetivo.
Mantenimiento de documentación (guías/manuales/píldoras formativas...) de ayuda a los usuarios de las aplicaciones.
Soporte en la realización de presentaciones y documentos.




Analisis y seguimiento:

Creación y mantenimiento de cuadros de mando y reporte en herramientas de BI (PowerBI, QuickSight,etc).




Seguimiento y aseguramiento de la parametrización coordinada de las aplicaciones, tales como:

-Parametrización de NdAs vs catálogos de avisos en SAP.

-Parametrización de NdAs vs hojas de ruta en SAP.

-Parametrización de NdAs vs unidades físicas

-Hojas de ruta vs catálogos de avisos.

-Coordinación de datos con la plataforma de gestión de descargos

-Coordinación de datos con Ágora

Diseño e implantación de las métricas de control de los procesos, tales como:

-Seguimiento de la creación de OT sin pasar por NdAs

-Seguimiento de la gestión de las NdAs, coherencia y validación en plazo

-Depuración de datos en el proceso de gestión de NdAs y creación de OT

-Análisis de indicadores identificados en auditoria y reporte

-Lanzamiento manual y monitorización del proceso de creación de OT - SAP desde trabajos en

SAGA.




Estudio analítica avanzada:

Elaboración de estudios de analítica avanzada para soporte a los estudios de negocio tales como:

-Estudios analíticos de correlación de variables para la mejora de modelos de predicción en gestión de activos.

-Análisis de comportamiento de variables de negocio para definición de estrategias de gestión.




Se contempla también el soporte en la mejora de procesos e identificación de oportunidades de mejora.




Requisitos:

Ingeniero Técnico o Grado -- Industrial, Informático o equivalente.
Power BI (mínimo 3 años de experiencia)
QuickSight (mínimo 3 años de experiencia)
SAP R3 y HANA
SQL gestión de BBDD
Administración de bases de datos relacionales
COGNOS
BW




Competencias Personales:

Proactividad, flexibilidad e iniciativa.
Capacidad organizativa
Trabajo en equipo: Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios, incluidos desarrolladores, arquitectos y especialistas en seguridad.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Remuneración competitiva y beneficios atractivos.
Planes de formación extensivos para fomentar el desarrollo profesional.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (porque sabemos lo importante que es la flexibilidad).
Oportunidades de crecimiento a largo plazo en una empresa global.
Flexibilidad para equilibrar tu vida profesional y personal.
Proyectos desafiantes en un entorno global.




Si estás listo/a para liderar la creación de soluciones que marcan la diferencia, queremos conocerte. 🙌




Haz de 2025 el año en que tu talento brille al máximo con nosotros. 💡✨

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Lisbon. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor's / Master's degree in information technology or similar;
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience in data analysis with python, pandas;
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
Experience with SQL, descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing;
Knowledge in big data would be a plus;
Fluent in English;
Hybrid model in lisbon - 2x/week
Candidates outside of Portugal won't be considered




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




· Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

· Provision of solutions in accordance with the company’s strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

· Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

· Deploy the solution within the group’s ProdSec entities of the group

· Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

· Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

· Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- définition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

• Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

• Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

• Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

• Flexible compensation plan.

• Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

• 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.
Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).
You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder™s™ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.
Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure.
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team.
Fluency in English.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference "CA/DataAnalyst".




Thank You.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Analista de Datos & BI
Description:
En esta posición, participarás en un equipo innovador donde cada análisis y modelo de datos contribuirá directamente a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajarás con herramientas punteras, creando informes y cuadros de mando que facilitarán la visualización y explotación de los datos.







💡 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

✅ Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.

✅ Formación continua para impulsar tu desarrollo profesional.

✅ Flexibilidad horaria y teletrabajo para una mejor conciliación.

✅ Posibilidad de trabajar de forma híbrida en nuestras sedes de Gran Canaria, Tenerife o Madrid, o de forma remota si tu residencia es diferente.







💡 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

🔹 Definirás y desarrollarás modelos de datos, informes y cuadros de mando para proporcionar información clave a los negocios.

🔹 Analizarás los requerimientos de los usuarios de negocio, asegurando que el reporting y la analítica de datos respondan a sus necesidades.

🔹 Construirás ETLs para cargar información al DWH del grupo, facilitando el acceso a los datos mediante herramientas de visualización.

🔹 Mantendrás y evolucionarás los modelos de datos, permitiendo el autoconsumo por parte de los usuarios de negocio.

🔹 Monitorizarás y diagnosticarás posibles incidencias en la actualización y consulta de la información disponible.

🔹 Darás soporte a los usuarios para que comprendan y utilicen correctamente los datos.

🔹 Garantizarás la seguridad, ejecutando de manera rigurosa y eficiente las medidas necesarias para la protección de la información.







✔️ Requisitos imprescindibles:

✅ Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería Industrial o similar.

✅ Experiencia de 1 a 3 años en un puesto similar.

✅ Nivel de inglés suficiente para desenvolverte en un entorno profesional.







✨ Además, valoramos positivamente si cuentas con:

🔹 Conocimientos en lenguajes propios del BI y Big Data: SQL y DAX.

🔹 Conocimientos en estadística, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías de almacenamiento e integración de datos.

🔹 Experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático con tecnologías Big Data.

🔹 Manejo de otros lenguajes como Python, PySpark o lenguaje M (Power Query).

🔹 Uso de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.

🔹 Familiaridad con ecosistemas y metodologías como Azure, Databricks, DevOps, GIT o Power Platform (Power Automate y Power Apps).

🔹 Conocimientos en protección de datos y seguridad de la información.







Buscamos a alguien con mentalidad analítica, iniciativa y pasión por la transformación digital. Si cumples con el perfil y quieres crecer en un entorno dinámico, ¡queremos conocerte!




🚀 Si te apasionan los datos y quieres impulsar tu carrera en un entorno dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Show more
HTML:
En esta posición, participarás en un equipo innovador donde cada análisis y modelo de datos contribuirá directamente a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajarás con herramientas punteras, creando informes y cuadros de mando que facilitarán la visualización y explotación de los datos.



💡 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

✅ Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.

✅ Formación continua para impulsar tu desarrollo profesional.

✅ Flexibilidad horaria y teletrabajo para una mejor conciliación.

✅ Posibilidad de trabajar de forma híbrida en nuestras sedes de Gran Canaria, Tenerife o Madrid, o de forma remota si tu residencia es diferente.



💡 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

🔹 Definirás y desarrollarás modelos de datos, informes y cuadros de mando para proporcionar información clave a los negocios.

🔹 Analizarás los requerimientos de los usuarios de negocio, asegurando que el reporting y la analítica de datos respondan a sus necesidades.

🔹 Construirás ETLs para cargar información al DWH del grupo, facilitando el acceso a los datos mediante herramientas de visualización.

🔹 Mantendrás y evolucionarás los modelos de datos, permitiendo el autoconsumo por parte de los usuarios de negocio.

🔹 Monitorizarás y diagnosticarás posibles incidencias en la actualización y consulta de la información disponible.

🔹 Darás soporte a los usuarios para que comprendan y utilicen correctamente los datos.

🔹 Garantizarás la seguridad, ejecutando de manera rigurosa y eficiente las medidas necesarias para la protección de la información.



✔️ Requisitos imprescindibles:

✅ Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería Industrial o similar.

✅ Experiencia de 1 a 3 años en un puesto similar.

✅ Nivel de inglés suficiente para desenvolverte en un entorno profesional.



✨ Además, valoramos positivamente si cuentas con:

🔹 Conocimientos en lenguajes propios del BI y Big Data: SQL y DAX.

🔹 Conocimientos en estadística, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías de almacenamiento e integración de datos.

🔹 Experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático con tecnologías Big Data.

🔹 Manejo de otros lenguajes como Python, PySpark o lenguaje M (Power Query).

🔹 Uso de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.

🔹 Familiaridad con ecosistemas y metodologías como Azure, Databricks, DevOps, GIT o Power Platform (Power Automate y Power Apps).

🔹 Conocimientos en protección de datos y seguridad de la información.



Buscamos a alguien con mentalidad analítica, iniciativa y pasión por la transformación digital. Si cumples con el perfil y quieres crecer en un entorno dinámico, ¡queremos conocerte!


🚀 Si te apasionan los datos y quieres impulsar tu carrera en un entorno dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!


Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).
Show more

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis across various projects to optimise company growth and business. You will manipulate datasets, create financial models, and summarise findings in a succinct manner for client's usage.




Responsibilities




Compile data into actionable reports
Prepare pitch and presentation materials
Work collaboratively with team members
Think strategically about improving company operations




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Business or Economics or related discipline 1 - 3 years of experience working with data in a related field
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Ability to work with people from many different cultural backgrounds.
Autonomous and organised
Ability to deal effectively with pressure
Be an organised thinker who can create order from complex situation
Fluency in English




If you are a dedicated MDM professional with a passion for data integrity and compliance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help us achieve excellence in master data management.




-------

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

WPP es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y considera a todos los candidatos para cualquier puesto sin discriminación ni distinción por características particulares. Estamos comprometidos con fomentar una cultura de respeto en la que todas las personas se sientan parte y tengan las mismas oportunidades de desarrollo profesional

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Participa en innovadores proyectos de ingeniería, aportando al equipo tu experiencia en el área de gestión y análisis de datos.




En ALTEN, sabemos que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 4 años de experiencia en Análisis de Datos y estás buscando un nuevo desafío, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




Participación en proyectos relacionados con los sectores Espacio, Defensa y Eficiencia Energética.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos?

Formación Académica: Ingeniería Técnica y/o Superior
Experiencia de al menos 4 años en trabajando en análisis de datos.
Valorable: Tener experiencia en BBDD de SQL y en el lenguaje de programación Python.
Nivel de inglés: Intermedio - Alto




🎯 ¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?

Análisis de datos dentro del entorno energético y económico.
Diseño y automatización para el análisis de datos.
Diseño y Desarrollo de procesos ETL.
Diseño de informes en POWER BI y Diseño de modelos de datos.




🌟 ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




🌍 ¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 3.650 millones de euros, contamos con 52.700 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Title: Reinsurance Data Analyst
Description:
At Abrivia, we are working with a company seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join a dynamic team specialising in data management and analytics within a global reinsurance environment. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on international datasets, support strategic decision-making, and enhance the efficiency of data processes across the business.




Key Responsibilities

Interpret, centralise, and manage incoming data from a global client base.
Prepare internal reports for senior management, committees, and regulatory bodies.
Support data-driven decision-making through insightful analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and streamline processes.
Drive innovation and efficiency in data management practices.
Contribute to continuous improvements in data quality and reporting accuracy.




Skills & Experience Required

Strong numerical and analytical abilities with clear communication skills.
Proven project or task planning capability in a data-focused environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, international setting.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Business Objects.
Advanced Excel skills, including the use of formulas, pivot tables, and data visualisation tools.
A proactive mindset with a focus on innovation and continuous improvement.




Please apply here or email sam.healy@abrivia.ie for more details.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For our client, a major player in the Belgian utilities sector, we are currently looking for a data analyst to reinforce their retail team:




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
Generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
Maintain close relationships with the business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of the business processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
Respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
Drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
Present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.




SKILLS

Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Agile and results-focused work ethic.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
Excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.
MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or equivalent experience.
Expert knowledge of SQL is required.
Expert knowledge of data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R is required
Expert knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik is required







Position in the Organization

Reports to the Data Analysis Manager.
Collaborates closely with team managers in Retail and squad leads.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Planner & Data Analyst Executive
Description:
The Planner & Sales Data Analyst Executive will be responsible for analysing sales data, creating actionable insights, and managing planning processes to support the company’s business objectives. This role involves developing interim planning tools using BI and Excel during the ERP implementation phase and transitioning these processes into the ERP system.




Responsibilities:

Develop sales forecasts and production plans based on historical data and market trends.
Collaborate with internal teams to optimize production, storage, and delivery operations to ensure product freshness and efficiency.
Gather and analyse data from internal and external sources, including merchandisers, category outlets, and national/international statistics.
Identify distribution gaps and channel development opportunities within the product portfolio.
Conduct profitability analysis for key accounts and recommend corrective actions for underperforming clients.
Create and maintain data models, central dashboards, and databases to support decision-making processes.
Perform regular data quality checks to ensure accuracy and integrity across all reports.
Prepare and present data-driven insights through reports, presentations, and visual dashboards.
Provide actionable recommendations to internal stakeholders to drive business improvements.
Analyse competitor pricing strategies and propose pricing alignments for all products.
Continuously evaluate and improve planning tools and processes to align with business needs.
Design, develop, and deliver customized reports to meet the organization’s needs, ensuring accuracy and relevance.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Valid driving license.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably within the FMCG industry.
Hands-on experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and advanced proficiency in Excel.
Experience with ERP systems or involvement in ERP implementation is an advantage.
Fluency in English is essential. Proficiency in Maltese will be considered an asset.
Advanced computer skills, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint, for reporting and presentations.
Strong analytical skills with experience in business analysis, data integrity, and creating dashboards.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively share data findings and insights.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.




Location: Central Malta

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Allianz Services is proud to serve and be part of Allianz Group, one of the world's leading insurers and asset managers. Our global footprint, with more than 7,300 employees located across ten countries and four continents, enables us to unlock value for our partners across the insurance value chain and deliver superior client experience within Allianz Group. At Allianz Services, we have a strong specialization in core insurance operations, shared services, business analytics, engineering, and management consulting. Our people and our trusted relationships with partners are what matter most. These are rooted in our values of compassion, integrity, and expertise and we strive to continuously evolve, improve, and deliver excellence while contributing successfully to the transformation of Allianz. Caring actively for the environment, for people, and for our customers is what makes us a great place to work and together we are shaping a better and more caring tomorrow.

Allianz Services is a company which belongs to the legal entity, Allianz Technology SE.

Job role

The Pricing Data Engineering & Automation team is part of the Global Pricing department at Allianz Commercial and is responsible for driving the development of data solutions within Pricing across Allianz Commercial globally. You will join an international department located across London, Munich, Bucharest, Chicago and New York.

Our global Pricing Data Engineering & Automation team is seeking an experienced Data Analyst for a role within the Pricing Function. In this role, you will work closely with the Head of Pricing Data Engineering & Automation and other key stakeholders to interrogate data and implement pipelines across the various Lines of Business and regions in Allianz Commercial to support advanced pricing.

We are looking for someone who is willing to get hands on with the company’s data and to develop innovative and structured solutions to bring it together in a way that maximizes its potential. This person will need to collaborate internationally with various stakeholders, both within the Pricing Function and across other Allianz Commercial functions.

What You Will Do


Investigate and interpret data flows from pricing tools and booking systems, identifying and explaining issues and behaviors to Data Engineers and project teams
Trace data sources, transformations and dependencies to pinpoint errors, inconsistencies and inefficiencies in pricing data assets
Build dashboards, reports and recommend automated checks to track data integrity, flag anomalies, and provide insights on data reliability to key stakeholders
Analyze data and work with team members in Pricing and Underwriting to configure mappings for ambiguous data attributes
Document and present on findings, including the creation of data dictionaries and visualizations for end-users to enable them to use datasets
Support end-users and collaborate with them to improve readiness of base datasets for modelling
Collaborate with Data Engineers, Pricing Actuaries and Predictive Modelers to deliver innovative data solutions for data-driven pricing
Develop knowledge of the company’s IT landscape, data and data systems
Contribute to a culture of results-driven collaboration, support and respect


What You Bring


Minimum 4 years’ experience using SQL for data analysis, with at least 2 years experience in P&C insurance
A degree at BSc or MSc level in a Numerical field, preferably with a strong focus on Computer Science, or qualified by experience
Experience in gathering information from stakeholders to understand business workflows
Experience in analyzing, debugging and solving highly complex problems
Experience using Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools for data visualization and anomaly detection
Experience taking ownership of own learning and development
Experience using PySpark (nice to have)
Some experience using cloud-based platforms for data analysis (e.g. Azure Synapse) (nice to have)
Some understanding of data engineering and machine learning project lifecycles (nice to have)


You have


Independent and self-directed individuals that thrive when faced with challenge
Ability to communicate and work effectively with technical and non-technical team members
Desire and ability to learn the business and become an expert in the industry
Organized, self-motivated, results-oriented, and very resourceful
Relishes problem solving, analysis and getting hands on digging into data issues
Fluent English skills, any other languages advantageous


What We Offer

We support your well-being

We foster an inclusive and healthy workplace with a flexible hybrid working model:


Experience access to counseling services, mental health resources, and well-being sessions designed to keep you feeling your best
Enjoy a monthly budget via the Benefit platform, for personalized benefits packages, including comprehensive medical subscriptions, meal tickets, private pensions plans, life insurance, Allianz Tiriac insurance discounts, and many more .
Prioritize what truly matters with time off for your birthday, extra days off for each year in Allianz (up to 5) , days off for legal holidays that fall on weekends, as well as 24th and 31st of December, plus special allowances to support diverse life events.


We invest in your growth

Benefit from an extensive learning curriculum designed to support your career advancement and meet your professional needs, with access to technical and soft-skills trainings, international certifications ( Agile, Lean Six Sigma, Prince, ITIL, IFOA, ACCA, IACCM and more), learning resources from LinkedIn and Allianz platforms, opportunities to advance your languages skills(German, French, English) and elevate with our leadership Program.

We value you and your work

We acknowledge and recognize your work through performance based-rewards to celebrate your achievements, team and individual recognition programs to celebrate your contributions and internal referral bonuses.

Your personal information, including sensitive data, may be shared with Hiring Managers to assess your suitability as a candidate. Only suitable candidates will be contacted, and all applications are confidential. Allianz Group, a trusted global insurance and asset management company, values employee ambitions and challenges, fostering an empowering environment. We are committed to diversity and inclusion, welcoming applications from all backgrounds, regardless of ethnicity, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, encouraging you to bring your whole self to work.


Show more

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $60,000 - $80,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract
Duration: 6 months

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MUST HAVE SECRET CLEARANCE OR BE ABLE TO OBTAIN SECRET CLEARANCE

NO C2C




The HR Data Analyst will be responsible for managing end-to-end reporting. The candidate will also work to identify reporting efficiencies.




Specific Responsibilities:

• Elicit reporting requirements from stakeholders to minimize churn and reporting errors

• Extract data from various sources and coalesce into clear and concise reporting

• Manage recurring and ad hoc reports requests and provide to internal/external stakeholders

• Develop intimate knowledge of the HR and Laboratory data landscape

• Subject matter expertise on PowerBI tool; participate in transition from SAP Reporting Analytics to PowerBI as primary reporting tool

• Adapt reporting format and data representation to optimize audience comprehension

• Monitor data quality and work to reduce systemic data quality issues

• Streamline and automate reports; comfortable with various data delivery methods

• Educates stakeholders on reporting self-service options

• Ability to extract deeper insights from data sets and identify correlations and patterns

Required Skills:

• Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or IT related field required

• A minimum of 3-5 years of experience with data analytics, systems analysis, or related discipline is required

• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel required

• Experience with SAP S4, including the HCM module and underlying data tables

• Experience with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting Module and underlying data tables

• Must have ability to respond under tight deadlines and prioritize deliverables while maintaining quality of work products

• Able to efficiently prioritize work and timely inform stakeholders on the progress

• Must be able to work independently as well as contribute to collaborative team efforts.

• Strong analytical thinking and methodical problem-solving skills with exceptional attention to detail

• Excellent written and presentation skills are required

Preferred Skills:

• Familiarity with SQL, data modeling, and database management systems desired




-Candidate should expect to be onsite 1 day a week.

-Interim clearances are sufficient to start.

-Interview process: 2 rounds of interviews; 1 technical pre-screen and then a larger group interview.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Supply Chain Data Analyst II

We are seeking an experienced Supply Chain Data Analyst to develop and optimize data-driven insights that enhance operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, technical proficiency, and experience in business intelligence tools to support data modeling and visualization for supply chain metrics.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and optimize supply chain dashboards to track key metrics such as on-time delivery, delivery health, and in-stock performance.
Create end-to-end dashboards utilizing Tableau and AWS Quicksight.
Utilize advanced SQL skills to manipulate, analyze, and extract insights from large datasets.
Work closely with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable data insights.
Apply project and program management expertise to streamline data analysis and reporting processes.
Support cost, lead time, and demand data modeling to enhance supply chain efficiency.
Leverage business intelligence tools to drive strategic decision-making and operational improvements.


Top 3 Must-Have Skills


Data Visualization & Dashboarding – Expertise in Tableau, AWS Quicksight, and other visualization tools.
SQL Proficiency – Advanced SQL skills to query and manipulate large datasets effectively.
Business Intelligence & Analytics – Experience in supply chain metrics, cost modeling, and demand forecasting.


Skills & Experience Required


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or supply chain analytics.
Strong knowledge of supply chain and manufacturing processes.
Proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and macros.
Strong stakeholder communication skills for presenting insights and driving data-informed decisions.
Experience with project and program management to improve reporting processes and operational efficiency.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working with large-scale datasets in a supply chain or manufacturing environment.
Ability to model supply chain costs, lead times, and demand trends.
Familiarity with additional programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.


This role offers an exciting opportunity to leverage data-driven insights to improve supply chain efficiency, working closely with key business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a passion for analytics, strong technical skills, and the ability to drive strategic decision-making through data visualization and business intelligence tools.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. $95,000 - $139,500

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Geode Capital Management is seeking a dedicated individual to join the Data Operations Team as an Associate Data Analyst. The Associate Data Analyst will play a primary role in ensuring our key data assets are complete, accurate, and ready for use by the firm on a daily basis. The individual will triage issues as they arise, escalate when appropriate, and execute any required corrective action. Through investigation and coordination with teams across the firm, the Analyst is expected to proactively improve the quality of our data and processes. In this role, the Analyst will become a “go-to” expert on investment data sets while supporting Portfolio Management, Trading, Research and other internal stakeholders.

This is a hybrid work environment opportunity located in Boston, Massachusetts with a weekly in office schedule of Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays and remote work availability on Mondays and Fridays.

Who Are You?


Appreciates the criticality of good, clean, data, that helps drive business impact
Team player - willingness to help with any task needed for team success
Clear communicator who can explain complex data problems in concise language
Determined, curious, and industrious



Responsibilities:


Serve as operational data steward for multiple sets of data assets including Security Reference, Index, and Market data
Validate the day-to-day completeness, accuracy and quality of all data used in the investment process
Identify possible data anomalies and research the root causes
Triage problems and flag critical issues for escalation to appropriate parties both internal and external
Collaborate with colleagues across the business for clear resolutions
Develop metrics, validations, reports/dashboards to evaluate and monitor data quality
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines
Identify ways to streamline our processes and automate standard maintenance
Take ownership of data quality and integrity in new initiatives and projects across the firm
Perform operational duties to support both Technology and Business teams as required



Skills You Bring:


4+ years of related experience in investment operations
BS/MS (Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related major)
Strong technical background and the ability to work independently
Strong SQL experience (minimum 3 years)
Experience working with various asset classes including equities, fixed-income securities, and derivatives
Security, Index, or any other Master Data Management (MDM) Experience
Flexibility to cover the morning (6:00am – 3:00pm) or afternoon (10:00am-7:00pm) shifts on a rotational basis
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Databases, Snowflake, Python
High attention to detail and supreme quality, while balancing both practicality and value-creation
Experience with Jira or similar Agile management tools



Company Overview:

Founded in 2001, Geode is headquartered in Boston’s financial district, the center of one of the world’s most vibrant finance and technology hubs and employs approximately 180 employees.

Geode is a systematic asset manager providing core beta exposures across a range of equity and niche asset classes, with over $1 trillion in AUM. With a robust infrastructure and experienced investment professionals, Geode offers the scale of a large asset management firm with the benefits of a smaller organization.

Geode is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and support a diversified work environment. Learn more about Geode at www.geodecapital.com.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

At MassMutual, we’re passionate about helping millions of people find financial freedom and this passion has driven our approach to developing meaningful experiences for our customers. The Data Engineering team, part of MassMutual’s Enterprise Technology and Experience organization, is comprised of highly skilled, collaborative, problem solvers who are motivated to create innovative solutions that exceed the changing needs of our customers and move MassMutual – and the industry – forward.

To continue our cutting-edge work, we are hiring an Advanced Data Analyst to join our team.

The Team/Job

Our ideal Data Analyst/Developer - Mastery candidate is proficient in data management and has a strong analytical capability. You’ll use your skills to provide subject matter expertise and complete in-depth data analysis, which contribute to the strategic efforts of the team. You’re also detail-oriented and adaptable. The team culture of working collaboratively, cross-functionally, using new technologies combined with the work/life balance provided by MassMutual are core reasons people enjoy working on the Data Engineering team at MassMutual. The ideal candidate has strong hands-on experience with enterprise data platforms such as Vertica/Teradata, as well as a deep understanding of life insurance operations and analytics.

The Impact/Key Responsibilities


Analyze data related to life insurance operations including policy administration, reinsurance, reserves, and risk to generate actionable insights.
Develop and maintain comprehensive data mapping documents and work closely with data engineering teams to ensure accurate data integration and transformation.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and create reporting solutions aligned to strategic objectives.
Partner with data engineers, architects, and IT to validate datasets, optimize queries, and ensure scalable data pipelines.
Work directly with offshore teams to coordinate analysis, share requirements, and maintain consistent quality and delivery timelines.
Mentor junior analysts by reviewing their work, offering guidance, and promoting professional growth.
Define and implement standards for documentation, analysis, and data governance across the analytics team.
Apply strong data modeling knowledge (star/snowflake schema, normalization, dimensional modeling) to support efficient analysis and reporting.
Help Build dashboards, scorecards, and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, or Strategy to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and compliance with internal controls and industry regulations.


The Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience
3+ years hands-on experience with Vertica or Teradata for querying, performance optimization, and large-scale data analysis.
3+ years of experience with advanced SQL skills


The Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience, including 5+ years within Finance domains.
Proficiency in Python
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Vertica, Teradata).
Familiarity with actuarial processes, reinsurance, or regulatory reporting requirements.
Industry certifications (e.g., LOMA, SOA exams) or data/BI certifications (e.g., Tableau, Microsoft).
Proven ability to write detailed source-to-target mapping documents and collaborate with technical teams on data integration.
Experience working in hybrid onshore-offshore team environments.
Deep understanding of data modeling concepts and experience working with relational and dimensional models.
Strong communication skills with the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
A strong understanding of statistical concepts, probability and accounting standards, financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement), and financial ratios.
Strong understanding of life insurance products and business processes across the policy lifecycle
Investment Principles: Knowledge of different asset classes, investment strategies, and financial markets.
Quantitative Finance: Understanding of financial modeling, risk management, and derivatives.
Regulatory Framework: Awareness of relevant financial regulations and compliance requirements.


MassMutual is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply. Note: Veterans are welcome to apply, regardless of their discharge status.

If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us and share the specifics of the assistance you need.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst – Supply Chain & Data Intelligence

Onsite | Boston, MA 02210

9-Month W2 Contract | $35–$45/Hour (Based on Experience)




Russell Tobin is proud to partner with one of the world’s most innovative technology and logistics pioneers in their search for a Business Analyst to support their Global Robotics Operations team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on high-impact supply chain and operational analytics in a dynamic, data-driven environment!




What You’ll Do

As a Business Analyst, you'll play a key role in building and optimizing dashboards that provide insight into critical supply chain metrics such as on-time delivery, delivery health, and inventory status. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams in robotics and operations to bring clarity and foresight to fast-moving logistics.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end dashboards using Tableau and AWS Quicksight
Leverage advanced SQL to query large datasets and extract actionable insights
Partner with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders to understand and deliver data needs
Support program and project management initiatives across robotics operations
Translate complex data models into meaningful visuals and business narratives




What We’re Looking For




Top 3 Must-Have Skills:

Data Visualization & BI Tools – Strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and Quicksight
SQL Expertise – Ability to manipulate and query complex datasets
Supply Chain Fluency – Experience working with operations, logistics, or manufacturing teams




Preferred Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science)
Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, Macros)
Familiarity with Python or R is a plus
Strong project/program management skills
Excellent stakeholder communication and business storytelling




Why This Role?

This is a backfill opportunity on a high-visibility team that's powering the future of robotics, automation, and fulfillment operations. If you're someone who thrives in fast-paced, metric-driven environments and aligns with principles like "Dive Deep" and "Deliver Results," this could be your next big move.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and let’s connect you with the team shaping the future of modern commerce.




Benefits Info

Pride Global offers eligible employee’s comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), supplemental coverage (accident insurance, critical illness insurance and hospital indemnity), 401(k)-retirement savings, life & disability insurance, an employee assistance program, legal support, auto, home insurance, pet insurance and employee discounts with preferred vendors.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
At Wasabi, we’re a proven collection of pioneers, visionaries and disruptive doers. We see things differently than our competitors, and we make our mark in the industry by challenging the norm and delivering the unexpected and improbable. We’re a fast-growing company taking the Cloud Storage industry by storm and recognized as one of the best places to work in Boston.

Wasabi hot cloud storage is a new class and category of cloud storage, breaking all traditional barriers and boundaries of storage with a disruptive value proposition of being 1/5th the cost of AWS S3, faster than the competition, with no fees for egress or API request and delivered as a single-tier solution. Cloud storage has never been so simple, so fast and so inexpensive. It’s all part of our vision to make cloud storage the next great global utility, just like electricity.

Role Description: Data Analyst Internship

Role Purpose

As a Data Analyst Intern at Wasabi Technology, you will work closely with our Business Intelligence team to analyze data and provide insights that will inform our business strategy. You will be responsible for collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large and complex data sets, as well as developing and maintaining dashboards and reports.


Principals only. No recruiters.


Responsibilities


Collect and process large and complex data sets from various sources.
Conduct statistical analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Collaborate with other teams to identify data-driven solutions to business problems.
Continuously monitor and improve data quality and accuracy.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis techniques and tools.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.


Requirements


Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with statistical analysis tools (e.g., R, Python).
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.


Benefits


Gain real-world experience in data analysis and business strategy.
Work on high-impact projects that will directly contribute to the growth of a fast-growing technology company.
Collaborate with a team of experienced Data Scientists and analysts.
Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
Competitive compensation.


Wasabi Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
